org.jerkar.api.file

Class JkPathTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.file.JkPathTree

  • public final class JkPathTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a view on files and sub-folders contained in a given directory or zip file. A JkPathTree may have some include/exclude filters to include only or exclude specified files.
    When speaking about files contained in a JkPathTree, we mean all files contained in its root directory or sub-directories, matching positively the filter defined on it.

        Creates a JkPathTree having the specified root directory.

      • getRoot

        public java.nio.file.Path getRoot()
        Returns the root directory. In case of zip archive it returns a directory entry within the zip archive.

      • getRootDirOrZipFile

        public java.nio.file.Path getRootDirOrZipFile()
        Returns root directory if this tree is a directory tree and returns a zip file if this tree has been created from a zip file.

      • getMatcher

        public JkPathMatcher getMatcher()
        Returns the filter defined on this JkPathTree, never null.

      • isDefineMatcher

        public boolean isDefineMatcher()
        Returns true if a matcher has explicitly been defined on this tree.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Returns true if the root directory exists.

      • createIfNotExist

        public JkPathTree createIfNotExist()
        Creates root directory if not exists.

      • stream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.nio.file.Path> stream(java.nio.file.FileVisitOption... options)
        Returns a path getOutputStream of all files of this tree. Returned paths are resolved against this tree root. This means that if this tree root is absolute then streamed paths are absolute as well. Note that the root folder is included in the returned getOutputStream. If this method is called for a zip tree instance, then it should be closed or called within try-with-resources statement in order to avoid resource leaks.

      • getRelativeFiles

        public java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getRelativeFiles()
        Same as getFiles() but returning paths relative to this tree root.

      • getFiles

        public java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getFiles()
        Returns list of paths returned by stream(FileVisitOption...) but excluding directories from the result.

      • goTo

        public JkPathTree goTo(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Creates a JkPathTree having the specified relative path to this root as getRoot directory. Note that the returned tree has no filter even if this tree has one.

      • get

        public java.nio.file.Path get(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Returns path relative to this root of the specified relative path.

      • merge

        public JkPathTree merge(java.nio.file.Path dirToCopy,
                        java.nio.file.CopyOption... copyOptions)
        Short hand for #merge(JkPathTree.of(dirToCopy, copyOptions).

      • merge

        public JkPathTree merge(JkPathTree tree,
                        java.nio.file.CopyOption... copyOptions)
        Copies the content of the specified tree at the root of this one. Specified dir to copy to might not exists. The structure of the specified tree is preserved. Note that the the root of the specified tree is not part of the copied content.

      • bring

        public JkPathTree bring(java.lang.Iterable<java.nio.file.Path> files,
                        java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption... copyOptions)
        Copies the specified files at the root of this tree.

      • deleteContent

        public JkPathTree deleteContent()
        Deletes each and every files in this tree except the root and files not matching this tree filter.

      • deleteRoot

        public JkPathTree deleteRoot()
        Deletes root directory of this tree.

      • zipTo

        public JkPathTree zipTo(java.nio.file.Path destination)
        Zips the content of this tree to the specified destination file. If the specified destination file already exists, the content of this tree is appended to the existing archive, overriding existing entries within the archive.

      • copyTo

        public int copyTo(java.nio.file.Path destinationDir,
                  java.nio.file.CopyOption... copyOptions)
        Copies files contained in this JkPathTree to the specified directory.

      • andMatcher

        public JkPathTree andMatcher(java.nio.file.PathMatcher pathMatcher)
        Creates a copy of this JkPathTree augmented with the specified JkPathMatcher

      • withMatcher

        Creates a JkPathTree which is a copy of this JkPathTree but the matcher is replaced with the specified one.

                              java.lang.String... globPatterns)
        Creates a copy of this JkPathTree augmented with the specified pattern matcher.

      • andMatching

      • andMatching

        public JkPathTree andMatching(boolean positive,
                              java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> globPatterns)
        Creates a copy of this JkPathTree augmented with the specified pattern matcher.

      • count

        public int count(int max,
                 boolean includeDirectories)
        Returns the file count contained in this JkPathTree to concurrence to specified max count. If the effective count is greater than max count, returns max + 1. This method is designed to stop file traversal as soon as count is greater than max.

      • resolve

        public JkPathTree resolve(java.nio.file.Path path)
        If the root of this tree is absolute then this method returns this tree. If the root of this tree is relative then this method returns a tree having a getRoot resolved from the specified path to this root.

      • toSet

        public JkPathTreeSet toSet()
        Returns a JkPathTreeSet containing this tree as its single element.
